lines.text: If an Englishman grows sentiments, he goes out into the garden and shoots himself.
How can one live happily in a country that's so difficult to get to?
We must face the fact that the prince is the best hated man in the country.
That would at least give Your Highness and myself something in common - to be opposite ends of the same stick.
Lord Palmerston, we are not amused!
I need to go back and discuss with Sir Robert Peel a new tax. He calls it the 'income tax'. I fear it is not going to be very popular.
I do not feel any great horror at the idea of the possible establishment of a republic in this country. I am quite certain that sooner or later, it will come.
Do you have steam trains in Germany Albert?
But not as fast as this. Look - there are the boys from Eton school and they can hardly keep up with us. That shows how fast we're travelling.
